item.title: Dean add a quote by Mike Scott
item.description: "Everybody's born to do a certain thing and if you're dead jimmy you've found it. And if you're good at something, just keep doing it until you're fed up...then do something else. look.. You're here to make babies and look after the place. You know ?" (Billy Connolly) Spoken Word on Spiritual city: -Off of Glastonbury Song" -- Mike Scott

item.title: Dean add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Dean add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Dean add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "From the moment I picked your book up until I laid it down, I convulsed with laughter. Someday I intend on reading it." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Dean add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Your task is not to seek for love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it." -- Rumi

item.title: Dean add a quote by Jalal Ad-Din Rumi
item.description:
"Out beyond ideas of wrongdoing and rightdoing there is a field. I'll meet you there.
When the soul lies down in that grass the world is too full to talk about." -- Jalal Ad-Din Rumi

item.title: Dean add a quote by Bram Stoker
item.description: "Despair has its own calms." -- Bram Stoker

item.title: Dean add a quote by Alice Walker
item.description: "No person is your friend who demands your silence, or denies your right to grow." -- Alice Walker

item.title: Dean add a quote by Alice Walker
item.description: "Deliver me from writers who say the way they live doesn't matter. I'm not sure a bad person can write a good book. If art doesn't make us better, then what on earth is it for." -- Alice Walker

item.title: Dean add a quote by Starhawk
item.description: "In a culture where profit has become the true God, self-sacrifice can seem incomprehensible rather than noble." -- Starhawk

item.title: Dean add a quote by Margaret Cho
item.description: "George Bush isn't Hitler. He could be if he applied himself." -- Margaret Cho

item.title: Dean add a quote by Margaret Cho
item.description: "I urge you all today, especially today during these times of chaos and war, to love yourself without reservations and to love each other without restraint. Unless you're into leather." -- Margaret Cho

item.title: Dean add a quote by Margaret Cho
item.description: "I was like, Am I gay? Am I straight? And I realized...I'm just slutty. Where's my parade?" -- Margaret Cho

item.title: Dean add a quote by Eddie Izzard
item.description: "What have you been reading, The Gospel according to St. Bastard?!" -- Eddie Izzard

item.title: Dean add a quote by Eddie Izzard
item.description: "They say that 'Guns don't kill people, people kill people.' Well I think the gun helps. If you just stood there and yelled BANG, I don't think you'd kill too many people." -- Eddie Izzard

item.title: Dean add a quote by Eddie Izzard
item.description: "Cake or death?" -- Eddie Izzard

item.title: Dean add a quote by Frank Delaney
item.description: "Do you know what the difference is between Friendship and Love? Friendship is the photograph, Love is the oil painting." -- Frank Delaney

item.title: Dean add a quote by Frank Delaney
item.description: "Start with the difficult and when it gets easy, everything else is easier." -- Frank Delaney

item.title: Dean add a quote by Frank Delaney
item.description: "Every pain is a lesson." -- Frank Delaney

item.title: Dean add a quote by John Hodgman
item.description: "Generally speaking, I think it is fair to say that I am a friend to the creatures of the Earth when I am not busy eating them or wearing them." -- John Hodgman

item.title: Dean add a quote by John Hodgman
item.description: "A stopped clock is correct twice a day, but a sundial can be used to stab someone, even at nighttime." -- John Hodgman

item.title: Dean add a quote by John Hodgman
item.description: "Stories hold power because they convey the illusion that life has purpose and direction. Where God is absent from the lives of all but the most blessed, the writer, of all people, replaces that ordering principle. Stories make sense when so much around us is senseless, and perhaps what makes them most comforting is that, while life goes on and pain goes on, stories do us the favor of ending." -- John Hodgman

item.title: Dean add a quote by John Hodgman
item.description: "I have learned that newborn infants roll their eyes around and move their heads and their arms in short jerky spasms. And if you homeschool them, they will stay this way forever." -- John Hodgman

item.title: Dean add a quote by John Hodgman
item.description: "That which is hard to do is best done bitterly." -- John Hodgman

item.title: Dean add a quote by John Hodgman
item.description: "Itâ€™s been a tough couple of years for condescending nerds. And if bookstores fall, Jon, America will be inundated with a wandering, snarky underclass of unemployable purveyors of useless and arcane esoterica." -- John Hodgman

item.title: Dean add a quote by John Hodgman
item.description: "I still have a fondness for books. Many a time I will be antiquing, and I'll say, 'What's that old-timey curio over there? What is that, a candlestick telephone, one of those old pull-chain toilets? Oh no, it's a book. I used to help make those things! I will buy it and use it to decorate my chain of casual family-dining restaurants." -- John Hodgman

item.title: Dean add a quote by John Hodgman
item.description: "How to Win a Fight - Step 1: Always make eye contact. Step 2: Go ahead and use henchmen - these days it's unnecessary and frowned upon to fight your own battles, especially with so many henchmen out of work. Step 3: Run lots of attack ads - I have run about 500 attack ads this year, and I expect that I will buy even more air time next year, because my enemies are getting stronger." -- John Hodgman

item.title: Dean add a quote by John Hodgman
item.description: "Manly deeds, womanly hands." -- John Hodgman

item.title: Dean add a quote by John Hodgman
item.description: "Houdini, the magician who debunked magic, could not bear to see the great rationalist [Arthur Conan] Doyle enchanted by ghosts and frauds. And so he did what any friend would: He set out to prove spiritualism false and rob his friend Doyle of the only comforting fiction that was keeping him sane. It was the least he could do." -- John Hodgman
